emerging_technologies.name: Advanced Brain-Computer Interfaces (BCI)
emerging_technologies.description: BCI technology allowing more direct and intuitive control over digital devices, with applications in medical rehabilitation, accessibility for the disabled, and immersive gaming.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances human capabilities, raises privacy and autonomy issues, potential for misuse in surveillance or control.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Dependent on advancements in neural tech, ethical frameworks, and public acceptance of invasive technologies.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum-Resistant Blockchain
emerging_technologies.description: Blockchain systems that are secure against potential quantum computing attacks, ensuring long-term security for digital transactions.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Ensures the longevity of digital trust systems, might require significant infrastructure upgrades.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Need for forward-looking security, regulatory acceptance, and the pace of quantum computing development.

emerging_technologies.name: Autonomous Urban Transportation
emerging_technologies.description: Fully autonomous vehicles designed for urban environments, reducing traffic congestion and pollution.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Improves urban living conditions, creates job displacement in transportation sectors, potential privacy concerns with vehicle data.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory approval, public trust in autonomous systems, and infrastructure readiness.

emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Personalized Medicine
emerging_technologies.description: Using AI to analyze genetic data for tailoring medical treatments to individual genetic profiles.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances treatment efficacy, raises issues of genetic data privacy and potential discrimination.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Progress in AI and genomics, regulatory frameworks for genetic data, and patient acceptance.

emerging_technologies.name: Space Resource Utilization
emerging_technologies.description: Technologies for mining and processing resources on other celestial bodies, primarily the Moon or asteroids.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Expands human presence in space, environmental considerations, international space law implications.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Technological breakthroughs, international cooperation, and economic viability.

mainstream_technologies.name: Smart Cities
mainstream_technologies.description: Cities using IoT and data analytics to enhance efficiency, sustainability, and livability.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread adoption in developed urban areas, with ongoing integration in developing cities.

mainstream_technologies.name: 5G Networks
mainstream_technologies.description: Ubiquitous high-speed internet connectivity enabling new applications in various sectors.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Global rollout completed, becoming the standard for mobile connectivity.

epoch_themes.description: Focus on creating technology that respects privacy, security, and human rights.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes trust in technology, reduces potential for misuse, enhances social equity.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increasing demand for ethical AI, regulations on data use, and public discourse on tech ethics.

epoch_themes.description: Development of cities that are self-sustaining, energy-efficient, and resilient to climate change.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Reduces environmental impact, improves quality of life, addresses urban sprawl.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Urban growth, climate action, and the rise of green building standards.
